qas.question: What did the government bring together ?
Once the decision was made to bring the group together who was it comprised of ?

answers.text: consists of 15 members from various backgrounds

qas.question: Has the joining brought about any changes in the region ?

answers.text: invitation to expatriates to return home to work for national development.

qas.question: Who extended the offer to the activists ?
Who addressed the United nations on Myanmar's behalf in the fall 2011 ?

answers.text: Myanmar's Foreign Minister Wunna Maung Lwin

context: The government has assembled a <a0_0>National Human Rights Commission<a0_0/> that <a1_0>consists of 15 members from various backgrounds<a1_0/>. Several activists in exile, including Thee Lay Thee Anyeint members, have returned to Myanmar after <a3_0>President Thein Sein<a3_0/>'s <a2_0>invitation to expatriates to return home to work for national development.<a2_0/> In an address to the United Nations Security Council on 22 September 2011, <a4_0>Myanmar's Foreign Minister Wunna Maung Lwin<a4_0/> confirmed the government's intention to release prisoners in the near future.
